title: [BUG] Origin context missing from Spark 3.3 exceptions
body:
**Describe the bug**
Some exceptions can contain an `origin` context string that ties the error back to the original SQL text input.  When the RAPIDS Accelerator is enabled, sometimes this origin context can be lost.

**Steps/Code to reproduce bug**
Thanks to @res-life for the following repro steps from https://github.com/NVIDIA/spark-rapids/pull/5137#issuecomment-1089661256:
```
spark.conf.set("spark.sql.ansi.enabled",True)

from pyspark.sql.types import *
schema = StructType([StructField("map_col", MapType(ByteType(), ByteType()))])

data = [({1:1},)]
df = spark.createDataFrame(data, schema)
df.show()

# test GPU
df.selectExpr("element_at(map_col, 5)").show()

# test CPU
spark.conf.set("spark.rapids.sql.enabled", False)
df.selectExpr("element_at(map_col, 5)").show()
```

**Expected behavior**
The exception message with the RAPIDS Accelerator disabled states:
```
org.apache.spark.SparkNoSuchElementException: Key 5 does not exist. To return NULL instead, use 'try_element_at'. If necessary set spark.sql.ansi.enabled to false to bypass this error.
== SQL(line 1, position 0) ==
element_at(map_col, 5)
^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
```
but the context is missing when the RAPIDS Accelerator is enabled:
```
org.apache.spark.SparkNoSuchElementException: Key 5 does not exist. To return NULL instead, use 'try_element_at'. If necessary set spark.sql.ansi.enabled to false to bypass this error.
```

**Environment details (please complete the following information)**
Spark 3.3.0
